title: Task 89

question.text: What does Anna mean when she says not right away?

answers.answer: She immediately started working in HR at a tech company
answers.feedback: Not right away indicates a delay or period before taking action, not immediate action.

answers.answer: She started working in a different role before moving to HR at a tech company

answers.feedback: The statement implies she did work in HR, just not immediately.

answers.answer: She was always focused on training and development
answers.feedback: Not right away suggests a progression or change over time, not a constant focus.

dialogue.text: Not right away. I worked in a general HR role at a non-tech company first, focusing on training and development.

description: The phrase not right away is used to indicate that something didn't happen immediately or at the earliest opportunity. It suggests that there was a delay or a period before the action or change took place. This phrase helps to set the timeline of events or actions.
